ResourceHeader.Description: The Radiation Assessment Detector (RAD) and its data products are described in detail in the literature (Hassler et al., 2012). Each RAD observation contains the following: (1) Instrument counters, (2) Neutral particle count histograms in detectors D and E, (3) LET count histograms, (4) Absorbed dose rate in detectors B and E, (5) High-cadence dose rate in B and E (16 rates per observation).
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the RAD Principal Investigator Dr. Hassler of Southwest Research Institute Boulder.. The RAD data are archived as fully citable data. Please consult the RAD team for further details on processing and usage of these data.

InformationURL.Name: Hassler et al (2014)
InformationURL.Description: The RAD instrument is described in detail in

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the Principal Investigator D. Hassler. Please acknowledge the Data Providers and CDAWeb when using these Data.

Parameter.Name: Alive Time of detector electronics
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] Actual instrument observation time
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: ALIVE_TIME, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Total Dose for B both total, and corrected for RTG background
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] Radiation dose rate on Mars (recorded in Si, corrected for MMRTG contribution, and tissue-equivalent plastic)
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: DOSIMETRY_TOTAL, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Total Dose for B and E in 1/16th time increments of an observation
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description:
[Quality filtered] Total Dose for an observation at 1/16th timeslice of an observation.
* Column 1 Labels from DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE_AXIS: ["Intrv 0","Intrv 1","Intrv 2","Intrv 3","Intrv 4","Intrv 5","Intrv 6","Intrv 7","Intrv 8","Intrv 9","Intrv 10","Intrv 11","Intrv 12","Intrv 13","Intrv 14","Intrv 15"]. * Column 2 Labels from DOSIMETRY_DOSE_AXIS: ["Total Dose B","RTG Corrected Dose B","Total Dose E"].
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Bin start time
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Bin start time

Parameter.Name: Total Dose
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Total Dose

Parameter.Name: LET spectrum in silicon
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] LET spectrum on Mars in Si (geometric factor ~ 0.9 cm^2 sr)
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: LET_A1A2, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Bin Start
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Energy at the start of the bin

Parameter.Name: Det. D + Det. E counts
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle (neutrons + gamma rays) counts on Mars
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_DE, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Counts in Det. D
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle counts in CsI
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_D, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Counts in Det. E
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle counts in tissue-equivalent plastic
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_FILTER_FLAG with the following input parameters: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_E, FLAGGED_DATA.

Parameter.Name: Alive Time of detector electronics
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [All quality] Actual instrument observation time

Parameter.Name: Total Dose for B both total, and corrected for RTG background
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [All quality] Radiation dose rate on Mars (recorded in Si, corrected for MMRTG contribution, and tissue-equivalent plastic)

[All quality] Total Dose for an observation at 1/16th timeslice of an observation.
* Column 1 Labels from DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE_AXIS: ["Intrv 0","Intrv 1","Intrv 2","Intrv 3","Intrv 4","Intrv 5","Intrv 6","Intrv 7","Intrv 8","Intrv 9","Intrv 10","Intrv 11","Intrv 12","Intrv 13","Intrv 14","Intrv 15"]. * Column 2 Labels from DOSIMETRY_DOSE_AXIS: ["Total Dose B","RTG Corrected Dose B","Total Dose E"].

Parameter.Description: [All quality] Neutral particle counts in tissue-equivalent plastic

Parameter.Name: Bin Start Energy
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Energy at the start of the bin for detector D

Parameter.Name: Bin Start Energy
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Energy at the start of the bin for detector E

Parameter.Name: Flagged data should be removed for science
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: [NO PLOT] Quality indicator - flagged data has quality issues from various sources, Commanding, DAN activity, Other; no value=good

Parameter.Name: Epoch TT2000
Parameter.Description: Epoch time tag
